Description: The LazyBone framework, written in JavaScript, intends to provide a platform to write simple lisp code and generating code for both client-side and server-side. The framework aims to provide features such as: Generating javascript code dynamically, built upon Backbone.js for the client as well as HTML dynamically with html-template. and provide some continuation-based syntax, which is natural in web application development in addition to other features.
BroadStreet framework aims to provide developers with an HTML5, Backbone.js and JQuery Control Set for mobile applications.

The Cerebral framework/library is meant to extend the base functionality of Backbone.js and intended to provide robust patterns of modularity, module loading, unloading and loosely coupled module communication through a pub-sub application core.
The Chalice JavaScript Framework intends to be a smaller framework that works on top of CoffeeScript Backbone and Node to render apps on the client and server side of applications.

The Capsule JavaScript frameworks aims to be an experimental web framework for Node.js that intends to use Socket.io and Backbone.js to synchronize model state by sharing model code between the client and the server.
The Tres JavaScript frameworks aims to offer an implementation of a Backbone.js pattern, with the intention to simplify application development by giving views control over animations on the screen.
Singool intends to be a lightweight JavaScript framework for developing single-page web applications
The Crossref Python SDK by Scott Chamberlain communicates with the API to access reference search features. It includes documentation, installation, and usage.
The Scoop.it PHP framework by zenria can access the API to integrate content features into emails, blogs, and social media. Instructions explain how to install cURL and copy configuration sample.
The Scoop.it Java Framework by Vincent Demay interacts with the API to integrate content features into emails, blogs, and social media. Resources include installation and usage.

The Scoop.it iOS Framework by Vincent Demay can access the API to integrate content features into emails, blogs, and social media. Visual resources explain how to create a project using the framework.

Feathers is a framework that enables real-time applications and REST APIs using JavaScript or TypeScript with Node.js. Feathers works with any frontend technology like React, Vue.js, Angular, Android or iOS. Feathers uses services and workflows instead of creating routes, requests or response handlers. This allows developers to work on application logic independently from how it is being accessed in order to automatically provide REST APIs, and WebSocket APIs.
The Base PHP SDK by Base integrates customer relationship features into applications. Usage demonstrates how to build a client, interact with architecture, and handle errors.
Hug is a Python Framework created by Timothy Edmund Crosley that is designed to make developing APIs in Python as simple as possible. Hug requires Python 3+ and is provided under the MIT License.

The Pin Payments C# SDK by Pin Payments allows API communication to integrate credit card features into applications. An example available demonstrates a card post charge with its respective description, amount, and currency.

Cocos2d-x Scala framework intends to offera suite of open-source, cross-platform, game-development tools for developers. The framework focuses on back-end development to allow for more front-end software development.
The Cocos2d-Pure Swift Objective-C Framework is a free and open source 2D game development framework. It intends to provide node hierarchy for Cocos2d game application development.

Blue Trip is a CSS framework that intends to offer web developers a 24 column grid layout, printing stylesheets, and form styling, all with a strong emphasis on typography to build upon for their website development projects.

Bootstrap is a Framework for developing web projects with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Bootstrap can scale websites and applications across different devices, such as phones and desktops. It is designed for projects of all sizes and developers of all skill levels.

The Broilerplate CSS framework's goal is to bring a lighter version of the Blueprint CSS framework, with the intent to allow for more freedom for developers in the overall design and development of websites.
The idea is to contribute more basic grids, typography, and stylesheets without the suggestion of un-semantic naming conventions.
Emastic is a CSS Framework that aims to offer various features to enhance CSS grids, and develop a baseline typography for web applications.

Cocos2d is a Python framework for building 2D games, demos, and other graphical/interactive applications. It aims to provide some conventions and classes to help with the structure of a "scene based application", including a workflow connecting the different scenes.

Baseline is a CSS framework that intends to offer a platform for developing a website with a focus on grid aesthetic and well developed typography. The framework's goal is to start with several files in order to reset the browser’s default behavior, build a basic typographic layout — including style for HTML forms and new HTML 5 elements — and build a simple grid system.
The FakeItEasy .Net Framework by FakeItEasy allows developers to create fake objects, mocks, stubs, etc. This .Net framework is compatible with both C# and VB.Net.

Apache Hadoop aims to be a framework for running applications on a large cluster of commodity hardware. The Hadoop framework intends to provide applications with reliability and data motion by offering a computational paradigm named Map/Reduce, which is an application that is divided into many small fragments of work, each of which can be executed or re-executed on any node in the cluster. The framework also aims to provide a distributed file system (HDFS) that stores data on the compute nodes, providing very high aggregate bandwidth across the cluster.
Scoobi is a Scala framework library that intends to facilitate the productive building of Hadoop applications. It allows for the functional programming of Scala.
ScalaBlitz is a scala framework that intends to provide efficient sequential and data-parallel collections for application development and testing.
The ScalaMaster framework aims to provide aicrobenchmarking and performance regression testing framework for the JVM platform.
